title: Update CLAUDE.md with Excel architecture
description:
Update CLAUDE.md to document:
- Excel processing architecture using calamine
- How Excel data flows through the system
- Sheet selection mechanism
- Data type conversion strategy (Excel types -> strings)
- Optional feature flag setup
- Key functions in src/excel.rs module
- Integration points with existing tabular pipeline

Add to 'Data Processing Pipeline' section and 'Common Development Patterns' section.

title: Update README with native Excel support
description:
Update README.md to:
- Add section on native Excel support (after 'Processing Microsoft Excel Files' section)
- Document how to build with Excel feature: cargo build --release --features excel
- Provide usage examples for .xlsx, .xls, .xlsb, .ods files
- Show sheet selection examples (--sheet, --sheet-name)
- Update feature list to mention native Excel support
- Note that Excel feature is optional (requires feature flag)

Keep existing Excel conversion section for users without the feature enabled.

title: Add native Excel file support using calamine
description:
Implement native Excel (.xlsx, .xls, .xlsb, .ods) file reading support using the calamine crate. This eliminates the need for external conversion tools.

Dependencies already added:
- calamine = { version = "0.26", optional = true }
- Feature flag 'excel' created

Remaining work tracked in subtasks.

title: Create Excel reader module (src/excel.rs)
description:
Create src/excel.rs module that:
- Opens Excel workbooks using calamine
- Iterates over sheets and rows
- Converts Excel data to tabular format compatible with existing pipeline
- Handles multiple data types (strings, numbers, dates, bools, errors)
- Returns iterator or Vec<Vec<String>> for processing

Key considerations:
- First row should be header (consistent with tabular format)
- Handle empty cells appropriately
- Convert all cell types to strings for masking
- Support lazy loading for large files where possible

title: Add 'excel' format option to CLI
description:
Update main.rs CLI argument parsing:
- Add 'excel' as a valid value for --format/-f flag
- Update help text to document Excel support
- Add --sheet/-s option to specify which sheet to process (default: first sheet)
- Add --sheet-name option to process sheet by name instead of index
- Ensure format validation includes 'excel'

CLI should support:
bytefreq -f excel < file.xlsx
bytefreq -f excel --sheet 2 < file.xlsx  
bytefreq -f excel --sheet-name "Sales" < file.xlsx

title: Integrate full bytefreq profiling into WASM
description:
Replace minimal profile_csv() with actual bytefreq profiling logic.

Need to adapt:
- Masking functions (HU, LU) - already Unicode-safe
- Assertion rules engine
- CSV parser integration
- JSON output formatting

Challenges:
- Remove filesystem dependencies (glob, walkdir)
- Handle stdin alternative (use string buffer)
- Ensure rayon works in WASM or replace with single-threaded
- Strip clap CLI parsing

title: Integrate Excel processing into main event loop
description:
Modify main.rs to:
- Detect 'excel' format and route to Excel processing path
- Read Excel file from stdin or file path
- Feed Excel rows into existing tabular processing pipeline
- Reuse existing frequency_maps, example_maps, column_names logic
- Support enhanced output modes (-e, -E) for Excel data
- Handle errors gracefully (invalid Excel files, missing sheets, etc.)

Integration points:
- Use existing Arc<Mutex<>> shared state
- Leverage Rayon for parallel row processing if beneficial
- Maintain compatibility with existing DQ and CP report modes

title: Build bytefreq as WASM module
description:
Compile bytefreq to WebAssembly for browser execution.

Steps:
- Add wasm-bindgen and console_error_panic_hook dependencies
- Create lib.rs with WASM-compatible profile_csv function
- Configure Cargo.toml with cdylib crate type
- Build for wasm32-unknown-unknown target
- Generate JavaScript bindings with wasm-bindgen

Dependencies already added, build in progress.

title: Add tests for Excel functionality
description:
Create tests for Excel processing:
- Unit tests for src/excel.rs module
- Test reading different Excel formats (.xlsx, .xls)
- Test sheet selection (by index and name)
- Test data type conversion
- Test error handling (invalid files, missing sheets)
- Integration test with sample Excel file in testdata/
- Test enhanced output modes with Excel input

Add sample Excel test files to testdata/ directory.

title: Create minimal HTML interface for WASM profiler
description:
Build simple web page that loads WASM module and profiles local files.

Requirements:
- File input (CSV/Excel)
- Load WASM module
- Call profile_csv() with file contents
- Display report in <pre> tag
- No server upload - all processing client-side

Privacy benefit: Data never leaves user's laptop.

title: Replace naive delimiter splitting with csv crate parser
description:
Replace string.split(delimiter) with proper CSV parsing using the csv crate (already in Cargo.toml).

Current problem:
- Naive .split(delimiter) doesn't handle quoted fields with embedded commas
- Causes ragged data issues on Excel-exported CSV files
- Fields like "Smith, John" are incorrectly split into two fields

Solution:
- Use csv::ReaderBuilder with configurable delimiter
- Handle quoted fields, escaped quotes, and proper field boundaries
- Apply to both header parsing and data row parsing
- Maintain compatibility with existing delimiter parameter
